alert.note: Alert for Marinette (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 10:24AM CDT until further notice by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Green Bay WI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan...Wisconsin... Menominee River near Florence affecting Florence, Dickinson and Iron Counties. Menominee River near McAllister affecting Marinette and Menominee Counties. For the Menominee River...including Florence, McAllister...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Menominee River near McAllister. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, water approaches River Drive and Shore Drive west of Wallace in Menominee County, Michigan. Water approaches South Park Road east of Porterfield. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 14.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 16.0 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.
